text.div:
Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition EHDSLaboratoryReport

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
EHDSLaboratoryReport 0..*EHDSDocumentLaboratory report model

Elements defined in Ancestors:header, header, presentedForm
Instances of this logical model can be the target of a Reference
header 1..1BaseLaboratory Report header
author[x] 1..*EHDSHealthProfessional, EHDSOrganisation, EHDSDeviceAuthor(s) by whom the laboratory result report was authored.
attestation
attester[x] 1..1EHDSHealthProfessional, EHDSDeviceAttester who validated the document
legalAuthentication
legalAuthenticator[x] 1..1EHDSHealthProfessional, EHDSOrganisationThe person or organisation taking responsibility for the medical content of the document (typically the person who signs it)
eventType 0..*CodeableConceptCategorisation of the event covered by the document (e.g. laboratory study types, imaging study types including modality, etc.). Selection of such tags or labels depends on the use case and agreement between data sharing parties. This meta-data element serves primarily for searching and filtering purposes.
Binding Description: (preferred): SNOMED CT
intendedRecipient[x] 0..*Intended recipient
intendedRecipientEHDSPatientEHDSPatient
intendedRecipientEHDSRelatedPersonEHDSRelatedPerson
intendedRecipientEHDSHealthProfessionalEHDSHealthProfessional
intendedRecipientEHDSOrganisationEHDSOrganisation
intendedRecipientEHDSDeviceEHDSDevice
body 0..1BaseLaboratory Report structured body
orderInformation 0..*BaseOrder Information (Laboratory Result Report could respond to multiple test orders)
orderId 1..*IdentifierAn identifier of the laboratory test order. Laboratory Result Report may respond to multiple orders.
orderDateAndTime 0..1dateTimeDate and time of the order placement.
orderPlacer[x] 0..1The person/organisation "authorised" to place the order. Order placer could be either a health professional, health professional organisation or the patient himself.
orderPlacerEHDSHealthProfessionalEHDSHealthProfessional
orderPlacerEHDSOrganisationEHDSOrganisation
orderPlacerEHDSPatientEHDSPatient
orderReason[x] 0..*An explanation or justification for why this service is being requested in coded form.
Binding Description: (preferred): SNOMED CT
orderReasonCodeableConceptCodeableConcept
orderReasonEHDSConditionEHDSCondition
orderReasonEHDSObservationEHDSObservation
orderReasonStringstring
clinicalQuestion 0..1stringSpecification of clinical question (goal of the investigation) to be answered by the laboratory investigation.
supportingInformation 0..1BaseAdditional clinical information about the patient or specimen that may influence the services or their interpretations. This information includes diagnosis, clinical findings and other observations. In laboratory ordering these are typically referred to as 'ask at order entry questions (AOEs).' This includes observations explicitly requested by the producer (filler) to provide context or supporting information needed to complete the order. For example, reporting the amount of inspired oxygen for blood gas measurements.
observation 0..*EHDSObservationClinical findings and other observations.
condition 0..*EHDSConditionCondition that may influence the service or result interpretation.
medicationAdministration 0..*EHDSMedicationAdministrationMedication administered before ordering the service.
sexForClinicalUse 0..1CodeableConceptA Sex Parameter for Clinical Use is a parameter that provides guidance on how a recipient should apply settings or reference ranges that are derived from observable information such as an organ inventory, recent hormone lab tests, genetic testing, menstrual status, obstetric history, etc.. This property is intended for use in clinical decision making, and indicates that treatment or diagnostic tests should consider best practices associated with the relevant reference population
Binding Description: (preferred): HL7 sex-parameter-for-clinical-use
vaccination 0..*EHDSImmunisationVaccination history of the patient.
otherSupportingInformation 0..*ResourceAny other type of relevant supporting information
specimen 0..*EHDSSpecimenSpecimen information
serviceRequest 0..*EHDSServiceRequestSpecification of requested service or services
resultData 1..1BaseLaboratory report result data
commentsInterpretationAndRecommendations 0..*NarrativeNarrative Comments, such as a textual interpretation or advice accompanying the result report, for example.
This profile does not constrain the narrative in regard to content, language, or traceability to data elements
laboratoryTestResults 0..*EHDSLaboratoryObservationObservation details (report could consist of multiple observations)
attachments 0..*EHDSAttachmentReport attachments

Documentation for this format

element.short: Laboratory report model
element.definition: Laboratory result report model.

element.short: Laboratory Report header
element.definition: Basic metadata for this information

element.short: Patient/subject information
element.definition: Patient/subject information

element.short: Unique identifier of the document
element.definition: Business identifier for the object, unique within its system. Supporting disambiguation between different contexts (systems/countries).

element.short: Author(s) by whom the laboratory result report was authored.
element.definition: Author(s) by whom the laboratory result report was authored. Multiple authors could be provided.
element.comment: Author of the laboratory report could be either a health professional who authored the report, laboratory itself or laboratory information system. Author information is the only mandatory element of the laboratory report header. As such, each laboratory shall be able to provide at least the author information.

element.short: Date of finalising/issuing the document
element.definition: Date and optionally time of authoring/issuing

element.short: Status of the document
element.definition: Status of the resource or document

element.short: Source of information (e.g. patient, patient's proxy). Used in case the patient has authored the information or the author has submitted patient-stated information.
element.definition: Source of information (e.g. patient, patient's proxy). Used in case the patient has authored the information or the author has submitted patient-stated information.

element.short: Language in which the resource is written. Language is expressed by the IETF language tag.
element.definition: Language in which the resource is written. Language is expressed by the IETF language tag.

element.short: Type of document at hand, e.g. 60591-5 Patient summary document.
element.definition: Type of document at hand, e.g. 60591-5 Patient summary document.

element.short: Human readable document title that can be displayed in search results, etc. This can be documentType's display name, or it can be assembled from multiple elements. Examples: 'Laboratory Result Report', 'Patient Summary of Jane Green 10.12.2024'
element.definition: Human readable document title that can be displayed in search results, etc. This can be documentType's display name, or it can be assembled from multiple elements. Examples: 'Laboratory Result Report', 'Patient Summary of Jane Green 10.12.2024'

element.short: Time of service that is being documented
element.definition: Time of service that is being documented

element.short: Business version of the document. The exact algorithm for versioning is decided by the producer/custodian
element.definition: Business version of the document. The exact algorithm for versioning is decided by the producer/custodian

element.short: Document attestation details
element.definition: Document attestation details

element.short: Attester who validated the document
element.definition: Attester who validated laboratory result report. Multiple attesters could be provided.
element.comment: Attestation (validation) of the laboratory report content is the usual step before legal authentication. Attestation could be provided by e.g. the laboratory specialist or the laboratory information system based on internal rules of the laboratory.

element.short: Date and time of the approval of the document by Attester
element.definition: Date and time of the approval of the document by Attester

element.short: Document legal authentication details
element.definition: Document legal authentication details

element.short: The person or organisation taking responsibility for the medical content of the document (typically the person who signs it)
element.definition: The person or organization taking responsibility for the medical content of the document
element.comment: Legal authentication of the laboratory report is the usual step after attestation. Legal authentication could be provided by e.g. the head of the laboratory or the laboratory organization itself.

element.short: Date and time when the document was authorised
element.definition: Date and time when the document was authorised

element.short: Categorisation of the event covered by the document (e.g. laboratory study types, imaging study types including modality, etc.). Selection of such tags or labels depends on the use case and agreement between data sharing parties. This meta-data element serves primarily for searching and filtering purposes.
element.definition: Categorisation of the event covered by the document (e.g. laboratory study types, imaging study types including modality, etc.). Selection of such tags or labels depends on the use case and agreement between data sharing parties. This meta-data element serves primarily for searching and filtering purposes.

element.short: Additional details about where the content was created (e.g. clinical specialty)
element.definition: Additional details about where the content was created (e.g. clinical specialty)

element.short: Organisation that is in charge of maintaining the document/report.
element.definition: Organisation that is in charge of maintaining the document/report.

element.short: A narrative easy-to-read representation of the full data set, e.g. PDF-version of a document
element.definition: A narrative easy-to-read representation of the full data set, e.g. PDF-version of a document

element.short: Intended recipient
element.definition: Information recipient (intended recipient or recipients of the report, additional recipients might be identified by the ordering party, e.g. GP, other specialist), if applicable

element.short: Laboratory Report structured body
element.definition: Laboratory Report structured body

element.short: Order Information (Laboratory Result Report could respond to multiple test orders)
element.definition: Order Information (Laboratory Result Report could respond to multiple test orders)

element.short: An identifier of the laboratory test order. Laboratory Result Report may respond to multiple orders.
element.definition: An identifier of the laboratory test order. Laboratory Result Report may respond to multiple orders.

element.short: Date and time of the order placement.
element.definition: Date and time of the order placement.

element.short: The person/organisation "authorised" to place the order. Order placer could be either a health professional, health professional organisation or the patient himself.
element.definition: The person/organisation "authorised" to place the order. Order placer could be either a health professional, health professional organisation or the patient himself.

element.short: An explanation or justification for why this service is being requested in coded form.
element.definition: An explanation or justification for why this service is being requested in coded form.

element.short: Specification of clinical question (goal of the investigation) to be answered by the laboratory investigation.
element.definition: Specification of clinical question (goal of the investigation) to be answered by the laboratory investigation.

element.short: Additional clinical information about the patient or specimen that may influence the services or their interpretations. This information includes diagnosis, clinical findings and other observations. In laboratory ordering these are typically referred to as 'ask at order entry questions (AOEs).' This includes observations explicitly requested by the producer (filler) to provide context or supporting information needed to complete the order. For example, reporting the amount of inspired oxygen for blood gas measurements.
element.definition: Additional clinical information about the patient or specimen that may influence the services or their interpretations. This information includes diagnosis, clinical findings and other observations. In laboratory ordering these are typically referred to as 'ask at order entry questions (AOEs).' This includes observations explicitly requested by the producer (filler) to provide context or supporting information needed to complete the order. For example, reporting the amount of inspired oxygen for blood gas measurements.

element.short: Clinical findings and other observations.
element.definition: Clinical findings and other observations.

element.short: Condition that may influence the service or result interpretation.
element.definition: Condition that may influence the service or result interpretation.

element.short: Medication administered before ordering the service.
element.definition: Medication administered before ordering the service.

element.short: A Sex Parameter for Clinical Use is a parameter that provides guidance on how a recipient should apply settings or reference ranges that are derived from observable information such as an organ inventory, recent hormone lab tests, genetic testing, menstrual status, obstetric history, etc.. This property is intended for use in clinical decision making, and indicates that treatment or diagnostic tests should consider best practices associated with the relevant reference population
element.definition: A Sex Parameter for Clinical Use is a parameter that provides guidance on how a recipient should apply settings or reference ranges that are derived from observable information such as an organ inventory, recent hormone lab tests, genetic testing, menstrual status, obstetric history, etc.. This property is intended for use in clinical decision making, and indicates that treatment or diagnostic tests should consider best practices associated with the relevant reference population

element.short: Vaccination history of the patient.
element.definition: Vaccination history of the patient.

element.short: Any other type of relevant supporting information
element.definition: Any other type of relevant supporting information

element.short: Specimen information
element.definition: Specimen information

element.short: Specification of requested service or services
element.definition: Specification of requested service or services

element.short: Laboratory report result data
element.definition: Laboratory report result data

element.short: Narrative Comments, such as a textual interpretation or advice accompanying the result report, for example.
element.definition: Narrative Comments, such as a textual interpretation or advice accompanying the result report, for example.

element.short: Observation details (report could consist of multiple observations)
element.definition: Observation details (report could consist of multiple observations)

element.definition: Report attachments
